xldv20pmCoIfIndex.name: xldv20pmCoIfIndex
xldv20pmCoIfIndex.description: This attribute provides the interface index of the PM object for which PM parameters are configured .

xldv20pmCoNrHistEntriesSize.name: xldv20pmCoNrHistEntriesSize
xldv20pmCoNrHistEntriesSize.description: This attribute is used to set the number of 15 minutes history entries which should be stored for history collection. Default value is 1.

xldv20pmCoIntervalType.name: xldv20pmCoIntervalType
xldv20pmCoIntervalType.description: This attribute identifies whether a 15 minutes interval or a day interval is selected in case of a resetIndividCurrent command.

xldv20pmCoControlReq.name: xldv20pmCoControlReq
xldv20pmCoControlReq.description: This attribute identifies a control command given by the SNMP agent. A reset for any individual PM object is possible via command resetIndividCurrent. The command setNrHistEntriesSize is used to set the number of 15 minutes history entries for history collection at a particular interface.

xldv20pmCoControlStatus.name: xldv20pmCoControlStatus
xldv20pmCoControlStatus.description: The status of a control request.

xldv20pmCoRemainingHistoryEntriesSize.name: xldv20pmCoRemainingHistoryEntriesSize
xldv20pmCoRemainingHistoryEntriesSize.description: This attribute indicates the number of remaining history entries which are available for the 15 minutes history collection wthin the ONU. PM on physical and ATM layer use the same history memory which is limited in total to 2000 entries. The manager can read this attribute after the execution of the setNrHistEntriesSize command .

xldv20pmCoOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmCoOAMLevel
xldv20pmCoOAMLevel.description: This attribute selects the OAM level f1 (1), f2 (2), f3 (3) .

xldv20pmCoControlReqResult.name: xldv20pmCoControlReqResult
xldv20pmCoControlReqResult.description: The result of the last user command.

xldv20pmCoControlTimeStamp.name: xldv20pmCoControlTimeStamp
xldv20pmCoControlTimeStamp.description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).

xldv20pmAcoIndex.name: xldv20pmAcoIndex
xldv20pmAcoIndex.description: This attribute provides the index of the AtmPm object for which PM parameters shall be configured .

xldv20pmAcoNrHistEntriesSize.name: xldv20pmAcoNrHistEntriesSize
xldv20pmAcoNrHistEntriesSize.description: This attribute is used to set the number of 15 minutes history entries which should be stored for history collection. The set HistEntrySize value is found in the xldv20pmAcHistEntrySize.

xldv20pmAcoIntervalType.name: xldv20pmAcoIntervalType
xldv20pmAcoIntervalType.description: This attribute identifies whether a 15 minutes interval or a day interval is selected in case of a resetIndividCurrent command.

xldv20pmAcoControlReq.name: xldv20pmAcoControlReq
xldv20pmAcoControlReq.description: This attribute identifies a control command given by the SNMP agent. A reset for any individual PM object is possible via command resetIndividCurrent. The command setNrHistEntriesSize is used to set the number of 15 minutes history entries for history collection at a particular interface. The commands create/delete are used to create/delete AtmPm monitoring objectes (entry in table xldv20pmAtmObjectsTable). The commands addEndpoint/deleteEndpoint are used to add or delete AtmPm endpoints to/from an PMo monitoring object.

xldv20pmAcoControlStatus.name: xldv20pmAcoControlStatus
xldv20pmAcoControlStatus.description: The status of a control request.

xldv20pmAcoRemainingHistoryEntriesSize.name: xldv20pmAcoRemainingHistoryEntriesSize
xldv20pmAcoRemainingHistoryEntriesSize.description: This attribute indicates the number of remaining history entries which are available for the 15 minutes history collection within the ONU. PM on physical and ATM layer use the same history memory which is limited in total to 2000 entries. Commonly used by PM on physical and ATM layer The manager can read this attribute after the execution of the setNrHistEntriesSize command .

xldv20pmAcoFlowType.name: xldv20pmAcoFlowType
xldv20pmAcoFlowType.description: This attribute identifies the flow type : F4 (VP) or F5 (VC) segment or endToEnd flow.

xldv20pmAcoFlowDirection.name: xldv20pmAcoFlowDirection
xldv20pmAcoFlowDirection.description: The flow direction of OAM cells. 'inwards' means flow direction from outside (external interface) to cross connection. 'outwards' means flow direction from inside to external interface.

xldv20pmAcoConnectionIndex.name: xldv20pmAcoConnectionIndex
xldv20pmAcoConnectionIndex.description: This attribute identifies the index of a Vpl or Vcl cross connection.

xldv20pmAcoConnectionIndexType.name: xldv20pmAcoConnectionIndexType
xldv20pmAcoConnectionIndexType.description: This attribute identifies the type of connection index and the termination point. It is in case of vplUni/vplNni : index of Vpl CC (xldv20AccVpiNniIndex) vclUni/vplNni : index of Vcl CC (xldv20VcxIndex).

xldv20pmAcoRole.name: xldv20pmAcoRole
xldv20pmAcoRole.description: The role of endpoint. 'analyseWithBackwardReporting' (sink) means extracting forward monitoring (FM) OAM cells, sending back backward reporting OAM cells and no data collection for current and history table. 'analyseWithoutBackwardReporting' (sink) means extracting FM cells without any other OAM handling and also collecting data. 'generateWithCollect' (source) means inserting FM cells, extracting backward reporting cells if they arrive and collect data for current and history table. 'generateWithoutCollect' (source) means inserting FM cells but without collecting data. The CMU, the Ethernet part of the Twin NT s capable of operating as inserting or extracting point.

xldv20pmAcoControlReqResult.name: xldv20pmAcoControlReqResult
xldv20pmAcoControlReqResult.description: The result of the last user command.

xldv20pmAcoControlTimeStamp.name: xldv20pmAcoControlTimeStamp
xldv20pmAcoControlTimeStamp.description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).

xldv20pmCommonCurrentTable.name: xldv20pmCommonCurrentTable
xldv20pmCommonCurrentTable.description: This table contains the entries for the current 15 minute interval or the current day of PMo objects of the common group. (adc, adr, e3n and e3f) .

xldv20pmCommonCurrentEntry.name: xldv20pmCommonCurrentEntry
xldv20pmCommonCurrentEntry.description: An entry describing the Common Current Data Table .

xldv20pmCcIntervalType.name: xldv20pmCcIntervalType
xldv20pmCcIntervalType.description: This attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmCcOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmCcOAMLevel
xldv20pmCcOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmCcAdminState.name: xldv20pmCcAdminState
xldv20pmCcAdminState.description: This read-write attribute is used to activate (unlock) and deactivate (lock) the functions (incl. collection) performed by this managed entity. Note: the 15min collection object must be activated, before day collection can operate.

xldv20pmCcSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmCcSuspectFlag
xldv20pmCcSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmCcHistEntrySize.name: xldv20pmCcHistEntrySize
xldv20pmCcHistEntrySize.description: The number of 15min history entries configured at the particular interface. This attribute is used for history data collection. The default value is 1 and means at least one history entry is desired .

xldv20pmCcNrHistEntriesAvailable.name: xldv20pmCcNrHistEntriesAvailable
xldv20pmCcNrHistEntriesAvailable.description: This read-only attribute indicates how many HistEntries are already available. The range of values is between 0 and xldv20pmCcHistEntrySize, thereby 0 means that this entry is not valid .

xldv20pmCcElapsedTime.name: xldv20pmCcElapsedTime
xldv20pmCcElapsedTime.description: This read-only attribute represents the difference between the current time and the start of the present summary interval. Units are seconds when 15 minute interval is selected or minutes for day interval. (Note: accurate to the sample time interval).

xldv20pmCcThresholdLimitIndex.name: xldv20pmCcThresholdLimitIndex
xldv20pmCcThresholdLimitIndex.description: This read-write attribute provides an index to the ThresholdLimitTable managed entity that contains the threshold limits for the performance parameters reported by this managed entity. When the value of this attribute is set to 1, default threshold limits shall be used .

xldv20pmCcNeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmCcNeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmCcNeErroredSeconds.description: A near end counter of Errored Seconds (ES) over a 15 min/day interval. Counter appearence depends on interface type and OAM level : - adc, e3n: valid for F3 level .

xldv20pmCcFeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmCcFeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmCcFeErroredSeconds.description: A far end counter of Errored Seconds (ES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter appearence depends on interface type and OAM level : - adr, e3f: valid for F3 level .

xldv20pmCcNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmCcNeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmCcNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: Represents a near end counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter appearence depends on interface type and OAM level : - adc, e3n: valid for F3 level .

xldv20pmCcFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmCcFeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmCcFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter appearence depends on interface type and OAM level : - adr, e3f: valid for F3 level .

xldv20pmCcNeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmCcNeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmCcNeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a near end counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter appearence depends on interface type and OAM level : - adc, e3n: valid for F3 level .

xldv20pmCcFeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmCcFeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmCcFeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter appearence depends on interface type and OAM level : - adr, e3f: valid for F3 level .

xldv20pmCcNeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmCcNeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmCcNeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : adc, e3n and f3 level .

xldv20pmCcFeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmCcFeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmCcFeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : adr, e3f and F3 level .

xldv20pmCommonHistoryTable.name: xldv20pmCommonHistoryTable
xldv20pmCommonHistoryTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PMo objects of the 15 min /one day-history data collection results at the respective adc, adr drop area interfaces .

xldv20pmCommonHistoryEntry.name: xldv20pmCommonHistoryEntry
xldv20pmCommonHistoryEntry.description: An entry describing the Common History Data Table .

xldv20pmChIntervalType.name: xldv20pmChIntervalType
xldv20pmChIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmChOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmChOAMLevel
xldv20pmChOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmChHistEntryNr.name: xldv20pmChHistEntryNr
xldv20pmChHistEntryNr.description: This attribute is an index used to address the PM history entry. Entry 1 is the most recent, entry 96 is 24 hours ago. The range of values is between 1 and xldv20pmCcHistEntrySize .

xldv20pmChSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmChSuspectFlag
xldv20pmChSuspectFlag.description: Will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmChPeriodEndTime.name: xldv20pmChPeriodEndTime
xldv20pmChPeriodEndTime.description: Date/time at the end of the selected interval.

xldv20pmChNeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmChNeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmChNeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a near end counter of Errored Seconds (ES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : adc, e3n and F3 level .

xldv20pmChFeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmChFeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmChFeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter of Errored Seconds (ES) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : adr, e3f and F3 level .

xldv20pmChNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmChNeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmChNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a near end counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : adc, e3n and F3 level .

xldv20pmChFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmChFeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmChFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : adr, e3f and F3 level .

xldv20pmChNeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmChNeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmChNeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a near end counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : adc, e3n and F3 level .

xldv20pmChFeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmChFeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmChFeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : adr, e3n and F3 level .

xldv20pmChNeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmChNeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmChNeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a near end counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : adc, e3n and F3 level .

xldv20pmChFeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmChFeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmChFeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a far end counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : adr, e3f and F3 level .

xldv20pmS3CurrentTable.name: xldv20pmS3CurrentTable
xldv20pmS3CurrentTable.description: This table contains the entries for the current 15 minute interval or the current day for STS3c near-end and far-end PPTPs.

xldv20pmS3CurrentEntry.name: xldv20pmS3CurrentEntry
xldv20pmS3CurrentEntry.description: An entry describing the STS3 near-end and far-end Current Data Table .

xldv20pmS3cIntervalType.name: xldv20pmS3cIntervalType
xldv20pmS3cIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmS3cOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmS3cOAMLevel
xldv20pmS3cOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmS3cAdminState.name: xldv20pmS3cAdminState
xldv20pmS3cAdminState.description: This read-write attribute is used to activate (unlock) and deactivate (lock) the functions (incl. collection) performed by this managed entity. Note: the 15min collection object must be activated, before day collection can operate.

xldv20pmS3cSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmS3cSuspectFlag
xldv20pmS3cSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmS3cHistEntrySize.name: xldv20pmS3cHistEntrySize
xldv20pmS3cHistEntrySize.description: This read-only attribute indicates the number of 15min history entries configured at the particular interface. The default value is 1 and means that at least one history entry is provided .

xldv20pmS3cNrHistEntriesAvailable.name: xldv20pmS3cNrHistEntriesAvailable
xldv20pmS3cNrHistEntriesAvailable.description: This read-only attribute indicates how many history entries are already available. The range of values is between 0 and xldv20S3cHistEntrySize, thereby 0 means that this entry is not valid .

xldv20pmS3cElapsedTime.name: xldv20pmS3cElapsedTime
xldv20pmS3cElapsedTime.description: This read-only attribute represents the difference between the current time and the start of the present summary interval. Units are seconds when 15 minute interval is selected or minutes for day interval. (Note: accurate to the sample time interval).

xldv20pmS3cThresholdLimitIndex.name: xldv20pmS3cThresholdLimitIndex
xldv20pmS3cThresholdLimitIndex.description: This read-write attribute provides an index to the ThresholdLimitTable managed entity that contains the threshold limits for the performance parameters reported by this managed entity. When the value of this attribute is set to 1, default threshold limits shall be used The range of values is [1,30].

xldv20pmS3cNeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cNeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3cNeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cFeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cFeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3cFeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cNeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3cNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3n and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cFeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3cFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3f and for F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cNeCodeViolations.name: xldv20pmS3cNeCodeViolations
xldv20pmS3cNeCodeViolations.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Code Violations Errors within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cFeCodeViolations.name: xldv20pmS3cFeCodeViolations
xldv20pmS3cFeCodeViolations.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Code Violations Errors within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cNeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cNeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS3cNeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3n and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3cFeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cFeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS3cFeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3f and level F2 and F3 .

xldv20pmS3cNeSeverelyErroredFrameSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3cNeSeverelyErroredFrameSeconds
xldv20pmS3cNeSeverelyErroredFrameSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Severely Errored Frame Seconds within the current 15min interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s3n and F1 level only.

xldv20pmS3HistoryTable.name: xldv20pmS3HistoryTable
xldv20pmS3HistoryTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PMo history objects at the near-end and far-end STS3c interfaces. It contains results that are overtaken from the s3CurrentTable PM-object at the end of a 15 min /day interval .

xldv20pmS3HistoryEntry.name: xldv20pmS3HistoryEntry
xldv20pmS3HistoryEntry.description: An entry describing the STS3 near-end and far-end History Data Table .

xldv20pmS3hIntervalType.name: xldv20pmS3hIntervalType
xldv20pmS3hIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmS3hOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmS3hOAMLevel
xldv20pmS3hOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmS3hHistEntryNr.name: xldv20pmS3hHistEntryNr
xldv20pmS3hHistEntryNr.description: This attribute is used as index to address the history entry. Entry 1 is the most recent, entry 96 is 24 hours ago. The range of values is between 1 and xldv20S3cHistEntrySize .

xldv20pmS3hSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmS3hSuspectFlag
xldv20pmS3hSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmS3hPeriodEndTime.name: xldv20pmS3hPeriodEndTime
xldv20pmS3hPeriodEndTime.description: This read-only attribute is a record of date/time at the end of an interval .

xldv20pmS3hNeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hNeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3hNeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Errored Seconds (ES) for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hFeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hFeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3hFeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Errored Seconds (ES) for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hNeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3hNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Severely Errored Seconds (SES) for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3n and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hFeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS3hFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Severely Errored Seconds (SES) for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hNeCodeViolations.name: xldv20pmS3hNeCodeViolations
xldv20pmS3hNeCodeViolations.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Code Violations Errors for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hFeCodeViolations.name: xldv20pmS3hFeCodeViolations
xldv20pmS3hFeCodeViolations.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Code Violations Errors for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hNeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hNeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS3hNeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Unavailable Seconds (UAS) for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3n and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hFeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hFeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS3hFeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Unavailable Seconds (UAS) for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS3hNeSeverelyErroredFrameSeconds.name: xldv20pmS3hNeSeverelyErroredFrameSeconds
xldv20pmS3hNeSeverelyErroredFrameSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter for Severely Errored Frame Seconds for the passed up to 96 periods of 15 minutes and the passed day interval. Counter applicable for : s3n and F1 level only .

xldv20pmD3CurrentTable.name: xldv20pmD3CurrentTable
xldv20pmD3CurrentTable.description: This table contains the entries for the current 15 minute interval or the current day for DS3 near-end and far-end PPTPs. Note: Day PM collection uses the 15min interval results .

xldv20pmD3CurrentEntry.name: xldv20pmD3CurrentEntry
xldv20pmD3CurrentEntry.description: An entry describing the DS3 near-end and far-end Current Data Table .

xldv20pmD3cIntervalType.name: xldv20pmD3cIntervalType
xldv20pmD3cIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmD3cOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmD3cOAMLevel
xldv20pmD3cOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmD3cAdminState.name: xldv20pmD3cAdminState
xldv20pmD3cAdminState.description: This read-write attribute is used to activate (unlock) and deactivate (lock) the functions (incl. collection) performed by this managed entity. Note: the 15min collection object must be activated, before day collection can operate.

xldv20pmD3cSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmD3cSuspectFlag
xldv20pmD3cSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmD3cHistEntrySize.name: xldv20pmD3cHistEntrySize
xldv20pmD3cHistEntrySize.description: This read-only attribute indicates the configured history size. The default value is 1 and means that at least one history entry is provided.

xldv20pmD3cNrHistEntriesAvailable.name: xldv20pmD3cNrHistEntriesAvailable
xldv20pmD3cNrHistEntriesAvailable.description: This read-only attribute indicates how many history entries are already available. The range of values is between 0 and xldv20pmD3cHistEntrySize, thereby 0 means that this entry is not valid .

xldv20pmD3cElapsedTime.name: xldv20pmD3cElapsedTime
xldv20pmD3cElapsedTime.description: This read-only attribute represents the difference between the current time and the start of the present summary interval. Units are seconds when 15 minute interval is selected or minutes for day interval. (Note: accurate to the sample time interval).

xldv20pmD3cThresholdLimitIndex.name: xldv20pmD3cThresholdLimitIndex
xldv20pmD3cThresholdLimitIndex.description: This read-write attribute provides an index to the ThresholdLimitTable managed entity that contains the threshold limits for the performance parameters reported by this managed entity. When the value of this attribute is set to 1, default threshold limits shall be used. These default values are not part of the threshold limit table but are hard coded in the application SW of PM. The range of values is [1,30].

xldv20pmD3cNeErroredSecondsCP.name: xldv20pmD3cNeErroredSecondsCP
xldv20pmD3cNeErroredSecondsCP.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) within the current interval or current day, the generation thereof is based on CP-bit parity. Counter applicable for : d3n and F2 level only .

xldv20pmD3cFeUnavailableSecondsPLCP.name: xldv20pmD3cFeUnavailableSecondsPLCP

xldv20pmD3cNeSas.name: xldv20pmD3cNeSas
xldv20pmD3cNeSas.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of one second intervals containing one ore more Severely Errored Frame (SEF) defects or one or more Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) defects within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : d3n and F2 level only .

xldv20pmD3cFeSas.name: xldv20pmD3cFeSas

xldv20pmD3HistoryTable.name: xldv20pmD3HistoryTable
xldv20pmD3HistoryTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PMo history objects at the near-end and far-end DS3 interfaces. It contains results that are overtaken from the D3CurrentTable PM-object at the end of a 15 min /day interval .

xldv20pmD3HistoryEntry.name: xldv20pmD3HistoryEntry
xldv20pmD3HistoryEntry.description: An entry describing the DS3 near-end and far-end History Data Table .

xldv20pmD3hIntervalType.name: xldv20pmD3hIntervalType
xldv20pmD3hIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmD3hOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmD3hOAMLevel
xldv20pmD3hOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmD3hHistEntryNr.name: xldv20pmD3hHistEntryNr
xldv20pmD3hHistEntryNr.description: This attribute is used as index to address a history entry. Entry 1 is the most recent, entry 96 is 24 hours ago. The range of values is between 1 and xldv20pmD3cHistEntrySize .

xldv20pmD3hSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmD3hSuspectFlag
xldv20pmD3hSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmD3hPeriodEndTime.name: xldv20pmD3hPeriodEndTime
xldv20pmD3hPeriodEndTime.description: This read-only attribute is a record of date/time at the end of an interval .

xldv20pmS1CurrentTable.name: xldv20pmS1CurrentTable
xldv20pmS1CurrentTable.description: This table contains the entries for the current 15 minute interval or the current day for STM1 near-end and far-end PPTPs. Note: Day PM collection uses the 15min interval results .

xldv20pmS1CurrentEntry.name: xldv20pmS1CurrentEntry
xldv20pmS1CurrentEntry.description: An entry describing the Stm1 Current Data Table .

xldv20pmS1cIntervalType.name: xldv20pmS1cIntervalType
xldv20pmS1cIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmS1cOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmS1cOAMLevel
xldv20pmS1cOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmS1cAdminState.name: xldv20pmS1cAdminState
xldv20pmS1cAdminState.description: This read-write attribute is used to activate (unlock) and deactivate (lock) the functions (incl. collection) performed by this managed entity. Note: the 15min collection object must be activated, before day collection can operate.

xldv20pmS1cSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmS1cSuspectFlag
xldv20pmS1cSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmS1cHistEntrySize.name: xldv20pmS1cHistEntrySize
xldv20pmS1cHistEntrySize.description: This read-only attribute indicates the configured history size. The default value is 1 and means that at least one history entry is provided.

xldv20pmS1cNrHistEntriesAvailable.name: xldv20pmS1cNrHistEntriesAvailable
xldv20pmS1cNrHistEntriesAvailable.description: This read-only attribute indicates how many history entries are already available. The range of values is between 0 and xldv20pmS1cHistEntrySize, thereby 0 means that this entry is not valid .

xldv20pmS1cElapsedTime.name: xldv20pmS1cElapsedTime
xldv20pmS1cElapsedTime.description: This read-only attribute represents the difference between the current time and the start of the present summary interval. Units are seconds when 15 minute interval is selected or minutes for day interval. (Note: accurate to the sample time interval).

xldv20pmS1cThresholdLimitIndex.name: xldv20pmS1cThresholdLimitIndex
xldv20pmS1cThresholdLimitIndex.description: This read-write attribute provides an index to the ThresholdLimitTable managed entity that contains the threshold limits for the performance parameters reported by this managed entity. When the value of this attribute is set to 1, default threshold limits shall be used. These default values are not part of the threshold limit table but are hard coded in the application SW of PM.

xldv20pmS1cNeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cNeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS1cNeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1cFeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cFeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS1cFeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1cNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cNeSeverelyErroredSeconds

xldv20pmS1cFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1cNeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmS1cNeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmS1cNeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1cFeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmS1cFeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmS1cFeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1cFeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cFeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS1cFeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1cNeOfsSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cNeOfsSeconds
xldv20pmS1cNeOfsSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds on defect OFS within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1n and level F1 .

xldv20pmS1cNeAisSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cNeAisSeconds
xldv20pmS1cNeAisSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of errored Seconds on defect alarm indicatin signal AIS for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and F2 .

xldv20pmS1cNeLosSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1cNeLosSeconds
xldv20pmS1cNeLosSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of errored Seconds on defect LOS within the current 15 minute interval or current day. Counter applicable for : s1n and level F1.

xldv20pmS1HistoryTable.name: xldv20pmS1HistoryTable
xldv20pmS1HistoryTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PMo objects of the 15 min /one day-history data collection results at the respective stm1 (s1n, s1f) drop area interfaces .

xldv20pmS1HistoryEntry.name: xldv20pmS1HistoryEntry
xldv20pmS1HistoryEntry.description: An entry describing the S1 History Data Table .

xldv20pmS1hIntervalType.name: xldv20pmS1hIntervalType
xldv20pmS1hIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmS1hOAMLevel.name: xldv20pmS1hOAMLevel
xldv20pmS1hOAMLevel.description: This attribute is used to select between the 3 OAM levels f1 (1), f2 (2) and f3 (3) .

xldv20pmS1hHistEntryNr.name: xldv20pmS1hHistEntryNr
xldv20pmS1hHistEntryNr.description: This attribute is used as index to address a history entry. Entry 1 is the most recent, entry 96 is 24 hours ago. The range of values is between 1 and xldv20pmCcHistEntrySize .

xldv20pmS1hSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmS1hSuspectFlag
xldv20pmS1hSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmS1hPeriodEndTime.name: xldv20pmS1hPeriodEndTime
xldv20pmS1hPeriodEndTime.description: Date/time at the end of the selected interval.

xldv20pmS1hNeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hNeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS1hNeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hFeErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hFeErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS1hFeErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds (ES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hNeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS1hNeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hFeSeverelyErroredSeconds
xldv20pmS1hFeSeverelyErroredSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Severely Errored Seconds (SES) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hNeBackgroundBlockErrors.name: xldv20pmS1hNeBackgroundBlockErrors
xldv20pmS1hNeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hFeBackgroundBlockErrors.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter for Background Block Errors (BBE) over a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hNeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hNeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS1hNeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1, F2, F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hFeUnavailableSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hFeUnavailableSeconds
xldv20pmS1hFeUnavailableSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Unavailable Seconds (UAS) for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1f and F2 and F3 levels .

xldv20pmS1hNeOfsSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of Errored Seconds on defect OFS for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and level F1 .

xldv20pmS1hNeAisSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hNeAisSeconds
xldv20pmS1hNeAisSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of errored Seconds on defect alarm indicatin signal AIS for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and level F2 .

xldv20pmS1hNeLosSeconds.name: xldv20pmS1hNeLosSeconds
xldv20pmS1hNeLosSeconds.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of errored Seconds on defect LOS for a 15 min /day interval. Counter applicable for : s1n and F1 .

xldv20pmAtmObjectsTable.name: xldv20pmAtmObjectsTable
xldv20pmAtmObjectsTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PMo objects on ATM layer. Maximum of monitored connections is 128.

xldv20pmAoIndex.name: xldv20pmAoIndex
xldv20pmAoIndex.description: Identifies an entry of the xldv20pmAtmObjectsTable.

xldv20pmAoFlowType.name: xldv20pmAoFlowType
xldv20pmAoFlowType.description: This attribute identifies the flow type : F4 (VP) or F5 (VC) segment or endToEnd flow.

xldv20pmAoAdminState.name: xldv20pmAoAdminState
xldv20pmAoAdminState.description: This read-write attribute is used to activate (unlock) and deactivate (lock) the functions (incl. collection) performed by this managed entity. Note: the 15min collection object must be activated, before day collection can operate.

xldv20pmAoBlockSize.name: xldv20pmAoBlockSize
xldv20pmAoBlockSize.description: This is the number of user cells after which PMo cell is inserted. Default is 128.

xldv20pmAtmEndpointsTable.name: xldv20pmAtmEndpointsTable
xldv20pmAtmEndpointsTable.description: This table contains the enpoints for PMo on Atm layer.

xldv20pmAeConnectionIndex.name: xldv20pmAeConnectionIndex
xldv20pmAeConnectionIndex.description: This attribute identifies the Vpl or Vcl cross connection where an endpoint object should be added.

xldv20pmAeConnectionIndexType.name: xldv20pmAeConnectionIndexType
xldv20pmAeConnectionIndexType.description: This attribute identifies the type of connection index and the termination point where an endpoint should be added.

xldv20pmAeRole.name: xldv20pmAeRole
xldv20pmAeRole.description: The role of endpoint. 'analyseWithBackwardReporting' (sink) means extracting forward monitoring (FM) OAM cells, sending back backward reporting OAM cells and no data collection for current and history table. 'analyseWithoutBackwardReporting' (sink) means extracting FM cells and also collecting data. 'generateWithCollect' (source) means inserting FM cells, extracting backward reporting cells if they arrive and collect data for current and history table. 'generateWithoutCollect' (source) means inserting FM cells but without collecting data. The CMU, the Ethernet part of the Twin NT can be inserting and extracting points.

xldv20pmAeFlowDirection.name: xldv20pmAeFlowDirection
xldv20pmAeFlowDirection.description: This attribute identifies the flow direction. inwards means flow direction from outside (external interface) to cross connection. outwards means flow direction from inside to external interface.

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentImaViolations.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentImaViolations
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentImaViolations.description: ICP violations: count of errored, invalid or missing ICP cells, except during SES-IMA or UAS-IMA conditions, in the current 15 minute interval. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-125) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77.

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentOifAnomalies.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentOifAnomalies
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentOifAnomalies.description: The number of OIF anomalies, except during SES-IMA or UAS-IMA conditions, at the near-end in the current 15 minute interval. This is an optional attribute. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (O-20) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeSevErroredSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeSevErroredSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeSevErroredSecs.description: Count of one second intervals containing >= 30% of the ICP cells counted as IV-IMAs, or one or more link defects (e.g., LOS, OOF/LOF, AIS, or LCD), LIF defects, or LODS defects, except during UAS-IMA condition, in the current 15 minute interval. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-126) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeSevErroredSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeSevErroredSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeSevErroredSecs.description: Count of unavailable seconds at near-end in the current 15 minute interval: unavailability begins at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMA and ends at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMA. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-128) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeUnavailSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeUnavailSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeUnavailSecs.description: Count of unavailable seconds at near-end in the current 15 minute interval: unavailability begins at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMA-FE and ends at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMA-FE. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-129) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77 .

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeUnavailSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeUnavailSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeUnavailSecs.description: Count of unavailable seconds at far-end in the current 15 minute interval: unavailability begins at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMA-FE and ends at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMA-FE. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-129) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77 .

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeTxUnusableSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeTxUnusableSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeTxUnusableSecs.description: Tx Unusable seconds: count of Unusable seconds at the near-end Tx LSM in the current 15 minute interval. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-130) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77.

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeRxUnusableSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeRxUnusableSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeRxUnusableSecs.description: Rx Unusable seconds: count of Unusable seconds at the near-end Rx LSM in the current 15 minute interval. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-131) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77.

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeTxUnusableSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeTxUnusableSecs

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeRxUnusableSecs.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeRxUnusableSecs
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentFeRxUnusableSecs.description: Rx Unusable seconds: count of Unusable seconds at the far-end Rx LSM in the current 15 minute interval. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-133) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77.

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeTxNumFailures.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeTxNumFailures
xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeTxNumFailures.description: The number of times a near-end transmit failure alarm condition has been entered on this link (i.e., some form of implementation specific transmit fault) in the current 15 minute interval. ATM Forum IMA v1.1, (R-134) and (O-26) in Section 12.2.2.2 on page 77

xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeRxNumFailures.name: xldv20pmImaLinkCurrentNeRxNumFailures

xldv20pmTcaPrMCurrentTable.name: xldv20pmTcaPrMCurrentTable
xldv20pmTcaPrMCurrentTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PrM object at the following tca layer locations: - STM1 interface (in downstream direction) - STS3-c interface (in downstream direction) - E3 interface (in downstream direction) - DS3 interface (in downstream direction) - SU_AD16 interfaces (in upstream stream direction). PrM also possible at IMA groups. It includes attributes for performance parameters, collection interval is 15 min /one day .

xldv20pmTcaPrMCurrentEntry.name: xldv20pmTcaPrMCurrentEntry
xldv20pmTcaPrMCurrentEntry.description: An entry describing the TC-Adaptor Current Data Table .

xldv20pmTcIntervalType.name: xldv20pmTcIntervalType
xldv20pmTcIntervalType.description: This nac type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmTcAdminState.name: xldv20pmTcAdminState
xldv20pmTcAdminState.description: This read-write attribute is used to activate (unlock) and deactivate (lock) the functions (incl. collection) performed by this managed entity. Note: the 15min collection object must be activated, before day collection can operate.

xldv20pmTcSuspectFlag.name: xldv20pmTcSuspectFlag
xldv20pmTcSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmTcHistEntrySize.name: xldv20pmTcHistEntrySize
xldv20pmTcHistEntrySize.description: This read-only attribute indicates the number of 15min history entries configured for the particular interface. The default value is 1 and means that at least one history entry is provided.

xldv20pmTcNrHistEntriesAvailable.name: xldv20pmTcNrHistEntriesAvailable
xldv20pmTcNrHistEntriesAvailable.description: This read-only attribute indicates how many HistEntries are already available. The range of values is between 0 and xldv20pmTcHistEntrySize, thereby 0 means that this entry is not valid .

xldv20pmTcElapsedTime.name: xldv20pmTcElapsedTime
xldv20pmTcElapsedTime.description: This read-only attribute represents the difference between the current time and the start of the present summary interval. Units are seconds when 15 minute interval is selected or minutes for day interval. (Note: accurate to the sample time interval).

xldv20pmTcThresholdLimitIndex.name: xldv20pmTcThresholdLimitIndex
xldv20pmTcThresholdLimitIndex.description: This read-write attribute provides an index to the ThresholdLimitTable managed entity that contains the threshold limits for the performance parameters reported by this managed entity. When the value of this attribute is set to 1, default threshold limits shall be used. These default values are not part of the threshold limit table but are hard coded in the application SW of PM.

xldv20pmTcDiscardedCells.name: xldv20pmTcDiscardedCells
xldv20pmTcDiscardedCells.description: This read-only attribute represents a counter of the number of ATM cells discarded at this interface, due to a HEC violation, since the start of this interval .

xldv20pmTcaPrMHistoryTable.name: xldv20pmTcaPrMHistoryTable
xldv20pmTcaPrMHistoryTable.description: This table contains the entries for the PrM history object at the different tca layer locations. It contains results that are overtaken from the TcaPrMCurrentTable PM-object at the end of a 15 min /day interval .

xldv20pmTcaPrMHistoryEntry.name: xldv20pmTcaPrMHistoryEntry
xldv20pmTcaPrMHistoryEntry.description: An entry describing the TC-Adaptor History Data Table .

xldv20pmThIntervalType.description: This type attribute is used to select between the 15 min or the day accumulation types.

xldv20pmThHistEntryNr.description: This attribute is used as index to address a history entry. Entry 1 is the most recent, entry 96 is 24 hours ago. The range of values is between 1 and xldv20pmTcHistEntrySize.

xldv20pmThSuspectFlag.description: This read-only attribute will be set to indicate that troubles arose during an interval and that the counter values are suspect and incomplete.

xldv20pmThDiscardedCells.name: xldv20pmThDiscardedCells
xldv20pmThDiscardedCells.description: This read-only attribute represents a set of history counter of the number of ATM cells discarded at this interface, due to a HEC violation, since the start of this interval .

xldv20pmThresholdLimitTable.name: xldv20pmThresholdLimitTable
xldv20pmThresholdLimitTable.description: The threshold limit table for all interface. This table associates threshold limit index/PM counter pairs with threshold limit values for a 15 minutes interval. Entries with same threshold limit index belong to the same threshold limit profile. Each of the following TC-adaptor types are available and can be configured: adc, s1n, s3n, d3n, e3n. A crossing of a threshold limit leads to a threshold crossing alert.
